text: the japanese city of san jo is a long
way from brookline massachusetts but the
two distant cities now share a
connection with one of the bloodiest
events of World War two the Battle of
Iwo Jima costs almost 7,000 American
lives 21,000 Japanese were killed one of
those Japanese was a 36 year old soldier
named matsushita Kagawa Tony no queda
miyoko decorate a Mon Ami my father was
strong and cheerful that's all I
remember because times were so hard then
I don't remember playing with him much
chea Tokugawa who is now 73 he is not
Susie's oldest daughter over six decades
ago she drew this picture for her father
when he went off for war Bogut's
Argentina and it's drill practice for an
airy the hat was designed to protect us
during an air raid the buckets of water
were passed from person to person to put
out fires with in missoula ma mean that
PA la Duchesse de foot then matsu she
kept the drawing along with a photograph
of his other three month old daughter
Yoko in his chest pocket he was killed
in February 1945 in the brutal fight to
take Iwo Jima and that could have been
the end of the story except for this man
my name is Franklin W Hobbs the third
and i live in brookline massachusetts
i'm now 85 years old and i seem to be
holding up pretty well I didn't even
know I was going to eat what we and all
of a sudden they just said we're taking
off we're going on a going on in an
invasion but they didn't tell us where
and all of a sudden we're with all these
boats in there pounding at this little
island and then after about three or
four days of it they said you're going
ashore as they took over the island we
were supposed to put in the wiring that
they'd have between the different
headquarters so a people in the
water dead lying there I'd never seen
such a thing before and when I was going
to show up I did a very stupid thing I
had a gun over my shoulder I let it fall
off and it went in the water and I tried
to claim I shouldn't go cuz I didn't
have a gun and they said we'll just pick
one up there'll be lots of them lying
there on the beach Frank Hobbs landed on
Iwo Jima he says that he and a friend
dug a hole and stayed there for two days
when they climbed out the dead were
everywhere I saw this one kid blonde
hair Justin handsome guy lying there
dead and i thought to myself god what a
perfect looking guy this is outrageous
that he had to die and nothing much I
could do about it but I realize how I
just hated the whole idea of the thing
because it seemed to me was terrible you
had to die over this tiny little island
mr. Hobbs began his job setting up
communications on the small island so I
was driving up and on the left there was
some people working with a bunch of
japanese that were obviously not alive
they were lying there on the ground and
they were going through and looking at
the papers and things and I just
happened by chance at the very end to
see a letter sticking out of the out of
the top of a jacket of one of the
Japanese people so I went over and I
grabbed it I glanced at it and I thought
I saw the picture of the little girl I
don't actually know to this day why I
happened to even do it other than all my
friends said they were gathering swords
and all these things and i thought i
might as well take something home and I
said this looks interesting i like it
put it in my barracks bag and finally
got at home the dead Japanese soldier
was not sushi Tokugawa and when I got
home my wife at that time I guess after
a few months she got it framed double
frame so you could see on one side the
picture of the kid and then also the
envelope itself and then on the other
side the picture of all the children
with their buckets getting ready to try
to put out fires and it hung in the room
of one of my son's for a long time but I
know exactly what the picture looks like
because we all grew up with it in fact I
think for most of the time I just
assumed it was a drawing my mother had
made when she was in kindergarten or
something the drawing
and the photo hung on the wall for 64
years until last March when mr. Hobbs
second wife Marge suggested that they
find the family to whom the letter
belong I saw that it was framed in and
had the address on I thought it was a
possibility a Japanese friend at their
church helped them using Japanese
characters on the letter and out of the
blue they found out where the family had
lived and they'd moved and they found
the daughter that was the one that did
the drawing they found her call you will
know that Nick told me that though may
three people came to me and asked me if
the letter was mine I said yes this did
the earth day hi I was so surprised that
my father had cherished a letter so much
I think he kept it with him to feel like
his family was close I don't want dinner
mr. Hobbs found she a in san jo japan
little did he know that her sister the
baby pictured in the photograph lived
just a short drive away from him in Fort
Lee New Jersey you know my life is so
changed since I got that I found out my
father kept my 3 monsters or picture and
my sisters the wrong picture this don't
we yo kotake gawa never knew her father
she was born after her father left for
the war she moved to the United States
as a missionary in 1973 when she and her
daughter ke Chi learned about the letter
she drove to brookline massachusetts to
meet mr. Hobbs Yoko came on one morning
she suddenly arrived I didn't know i
gave her a big hug and then she said
that that's how much it meant to or
something it hit me quite hard as a
matter of fact I thought this is really
amazing that we found her and now she's
going to have the picture I got tears in
my eyes because I suddenly realized what
she'd gone through you know no father
very early and not knowing really what
happened to him
for Yoko the discovery of the letter has
awakened deep feelings for a man whose
face she knew only from a few family
photos all right now I miss my father so
much I'm talking with my father
sometimes would you like sashimi or drug
pitch thank you so much for your
protection before I did not say at all
because i did not know his existence so
much but now I feel very much close to
him this means I very much appreciated
hope I'm but so happy they have it the
family has it and it sort of closes the
book for them in a little bit I don't
know why I feel that but I do I think
it's sort of if I got it then my father
had been killed and suddenly many many
years later I get his final letter the
final letter that went to him and he had
it on him when he's dying right next to
his heart well right in his pocket I
think I'd remember that
you
